tags.name: Vulnerabilities Dashboard
tags.description:
Vulnerabilities Dashboard(UVE) gives you a holistic graphical view of all the vulnerabilities across your Code to Cloud environment. The APIs in this section helps you to get the details that are displayed in the Vulnerabilities Dashboard widget based on various filters. You can asses the vulnerabilities and create request to remediate or mitigate the vulnerability. For more information about the Vulnerabilities Dashboard, see [Vulnerabilities Dashboard](https://docs.prismacloud.io/en/enterprise-edition/content-collections/dashboards/dashboards-vulnerabilities). 
>**Note:** You need specific access permission to use the endpoints in this category. For details on the required permissions, see the respective endpoint description.

get.description:
Returns a summary of the total vulnerabilities in your environment which is further divided into Vulnerabilities by Asset and Vulnerabilities that have already been remediated.
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

Returns a summary of the total runtime vulnerabilities in your environment which is further divided into runtime Vulnerabilities by Asset and Vulnerabilities that have already been remediated.
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

Returns a summary of the total unique vulnerabilities, the count of vulnerabilities, and the count of remediated vulnerabilities, including a breakdown by severity for each category. The percentage reflects the change between the current data and the data from seven days prior. **Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

Returns the top-priority vulnerabilities which are aggregated based on the most urgent, exploitable, patchable, and vulnerable packages in use. 
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

Returns the top-priority unique vulnerabilities which are aggregated based on the most urgent, exploitable, patchable, and vulnerable packages in use along with the number of assets they occur in. 
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

Returns the top-priority unique vulnerabilities which are aggregated based on the most urgent, exploitable, patchable, and vulnerable packages in use along with the number of assets they occur in.
 This endpoint also returns vulnerabilities based on internet exposure, in addition to those from [Get Prioritized Vulnerabilities V2](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/prioritised-vulnerability-v-2/). 
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

Returns the top-priority vulnerabilities which are aggregated based on the most urgent, exploitable, patchable, and vulnerable packages in use along with the number of assets they occur in. 
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

Returns a summary of vulnerability across app stages of your application lifecycle.
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

Returns the CVEs of top critical vulnerabilities in your environment based on the risk score. Each CVE includes risk factors, severity, CVSS, risk factors, and assets impacted.
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Number of  results to be returned

get.description:
Returns the CVEs of top critical vulnerabilities in your environment based on the risk score. Each CVE includes risk factors, epssScore, severity, CVSS, risk factors, and assets impacted.
 This endpoint returns the epss score details in addition to those from [Get Top Impacting Vulnerabilities](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/top-prioritised-vulnerability/). 
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

parameters.name: top
parameters.description: Number of  results to be returned

get.description: Get the overview of the CVE with its CVSS score, the impacted stages, severity, risk factors, the package name, and the distributions affected by this CVE.

Get the detailed information for a given cve. This endpoint returns additional information, such as EPSS details, CVSS details, exploit details, and environment factors, compared to the [Get CVE Overview](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/cve-overview/) endpoint.

Get the data for burndown chart.
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

post.description: Get the list of all the assets affected by the CVE.

get.description:
Returns a summary of vulnerable assets and detailed vulnerability statistics, including the total number of vulnerabilities by severity, registry count, package count, repository count, and more, across different stages of your application lifecycle. 
>**Note:** You need `vulnerabilityDashboard` feature with `View` permission to access this endpoint. Verify if your permission group includes this feature using the [Get Permission Group by ID](https://pan.dev/prisma-cloud/api/cspm/get-1/) endpoint. You can also check this in the Prisma Cloud console by ensuring that **Dashboard > Vulnerability** is enabled.

OverviewSummaryV3.description: Provides Summary of the uniqueCVES, vulnerabilities count and remediated vulnerabilities count

OverviewSummary.description: Provides Summary of the vulnerability, remediated and asset counts in Runtime

dayNum.description: Count down of the day backwards from present day

totalCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities in the given day

remediatedCount.description: Number of vulnerabilities remediated for the given day

epochTimestamp.description: Time upto which the entry was recorded

TraceStage.description: A ordered collection of subsequent trace stages

name.description: A unique name of the trace stage

apiIds.description: A collection of api-ids for this stage. If none are provided, then we utilize what the collection of ides that are default to this stage

source.description: The source from which the trace originates

stage.description: The stage of the source Assets

PrimaryAssetStageNode.description: A dictionary of the trace node identifier and the associated node

AssetStageNode.description: A dictionary of the trace node identifier and the associated node

count.description: Count of the nodes in a stage

filePath.description: The path of the file in the repo

packageName.description: The package name of the CVE

version.description: The package version of the CVE

Edge.description: The edges of the C2C Tracing graph

directed.description: Boolean value representing whether the edge is directed

relation.description: Relation between the source and target nodes

relationshipTypeId.description: Relationship Type ID between the edges

x-redlock-auth.description: The x-redlock-auth value is a JSON Web Token (JWT).
x-redlock-auth.name: x-redlock-auth
